setup.name: Set Hostname
setup.description: Assign a unique hostname to the device for identification.
setup.command:
configure terminal
hostname [DeviceName]

setup.name: Setup an Interface
setup.description: Step-by-step process to configure an interface with an IP address.
setup.command:
1) Enter configuration mode:
   configure terminal
2) Choose the interface:
   interface GigabitEthernet0/0
3) Assign IP address:
   ip address 192.168.1.1 255.255.255.0
4) Enable the interface:
   no shutdown
5) Exit configuration mode:
   end

setup.name: Setup a VLAN (on a Layer 3 interface)
setup.description: Create and configure a VLAN interface on a Cisco router.
setup.command:
1) Enter configuration mode:
   configure terminal
2) Create the VLAN interface:
   interface vlan [VLAN_ID]
3) Assign IP address:
   ip address 10.10.10.1 255.255.255.0
4) Enable the VLAN interface:
   no shutdown
5) Exit configuration mode:
   end

setup.name: Configure Static Routing
setup.description: Set a static route for routing packets to a specific network.
setup.command:
1) Enter configuration mode:
   configure terminal
2) Define the route:
   ip route [destination network] [subnet mask] [next hop IP]
3) Exit configuration mode:
   end

setup.name: Configure DHCP Server
setup.description: Set up a DHCP server to dynamically assign IP addresses.
setup.command:
1) Enter configuration mode:
   configure terminal
2) Exclude addresses from DHCP pool:
   ip dhcp excluded-address [start-ip] [end-ip]
3) Create a DHCP pool:
   ip dhcp pool [pool-name]
4) Define network and subnet mask:
   network [network address] [subnet mask]
5) Define default gateway:
   default-router [default gateway IP]
6) Provide DNS server:
   dns-server [DNS IP address]
7) Exit configuration mode:
   end

setup.name: Configure NTP (Network Time Protocol)
setup.description: Synchronize time with an NTP server.
setup.command:
1) Enter configuration mode:
   configure terminal
2) Define NTP server:
   ntp server [NTP server IP]
3) Verify NTP status:
   show ntp status
4) Exit configuration mode:
   end

setup.name: Configure Default Gateway
setup.description: Set a default route for traffic with no specific route.
setup.command:
1) Enter configuration mode:
   configure terminal
2) Set default route:
   ip route 0.0.0.0 0.0.0.0 [next hop IP]
3) Exit configuration mode:
   end

setup.name: Setup EIGRP (Enhanced Interior Gateway Routing Protocol)
setup.description: Enable EIGRP routing protocol for dynamic routing.
setup.command:
1) Enter configuration mode:
   configure terminal
2) Enable EIGRP and specify AS number:
   router eigrp [AS number]
3) Define the network to advertise:
   network [network address] [wildcard mask]
4) Exit configuration mode:
   end

setup.name: Setup OSPF (Open Shortest Path First)
setup.description: Enable OSPF routing protocol for dynamic routing.
setup.command:
1) Enter configuration mode:
   configure terminal
2) Enable OSPF:
   router ospf [Process ID]
3) Define network to advertise:
   network [network address] [wildcard mask] area [area number]
4) Exit configuration mode:
   end

basic.name: Enable SSH
basic.description: Enable Secure Shell (SSH) for secure remote access and disable Telnet.
basic.command:
1) Enter configuration mode:
   configure terminal
2) Generate RSA keys:
   crypto key generate rsa
3) Enable SSH:
   ip ssh version 2
4) Set VTY lines to only accept SSH:
   line vty 0 4
   transport input ssh
5) Set login method:
   login local
6) Exit configuration mode:
   end

basic.name: Setup AAA Authentication
basic.description: Enable AAA for user authentication, authorization, and accounting.
basic.command:
1) Enter configuration mode:
   configure terminal
2) Enable AAA:
   aaa new-model
3) Create local user:
   username [user] secret [password]
4) Apply authentication to lines:
   line vty 0 4
   login authentication default
5) Exit configuration mode:
   end

basic.name: Configure Access Lists (ACLs)
basic.description: Create and apply a standard or extended access list.
basic.command:
1) Enter configuration mode:
   configure terminal
2) Create access list:
   access-list [number] permit/deny [IP/any] [wildcard mask]
3) Apply to interface:
   interface [interface]
   ip access-group [ACL number] [in/out]
4) Exit configuration mode:
   end

basic.name: Encrypt Passwords
basic.description: Encrypt all passwords stored in the configuration file.

basic.name: Disable Unused Services
basic.description: Disable unnecessary services to reduce attack surface.
basic.command:
no ip http server
no ip http secure-server

basic.name: Configure Login Banner
basic.description: Set a security message for unauthorized access attempts.
basic.command: banner motd #Unauthorized access prohibited#

class [ClassName]

advanced.name: Check Open Ports

advanced.command: show ip interface brief | include up

advanced.name: Failed Logins Monitoring
advanced.description: Monitor failed login attempts.
advanced.command: show login failures

advanced.name: Detect Brute Force Attacks
advanced.description: Enable logging for potential brute-force attacks.
advanced.command: archive log config logging enable

setup.description: Restrict traffic based on IP addresses.
setup.command:
access-list [Number] permit [Protocol] [Source] [Destination]
ip access-group [Number] in

setup.name: Configure VLAN
setup.description: Create and configure VLANs for network segmentation.
setup.command:
1) Enter configuration mode:
   configure terminal
2) Create VLAN:
   vlan [VLAN_ID]
3) Name the VLAN:
   name [VLAN_NAME]
4) Exit VLAN configuration:
   exit
5) Assign VLAN to interface:
   interface [Interface]
   switchport mode access
   switchport access vlan [VLAN_ID]
6) Enable interface:
   no shutdown
7) Exit configuration mode:
   end

setup.name: Configure Trunk Ports
setup.description: Set up trunk ports for VLAN tagging between switches.
setup.command:
1) Enter configuration mode:
   configure terminal
2) Select the interface:
   interface [Trunk_Interface]
3) Set mode to trunk:
   switchport mode trunk
4) Specify allowed VLANs (if needed):
   switchport trunk allowed vlan [VLAN_IDs]
5) Enable interface:
   no shutdown
6) Exit configuration mode:
   end

setup.name: Set Management IP Address
setup.description: Assign an IP address to the switch for management access.
setup.command:
1) Enter configuration mode:
   configure terminal
2) Select VLAN interface:
   interface vlan [VLAN_ID]
3) Assign IP address:
   ip address [IP_ADDRESS] [SUBNET_MASK]
4) Enable VLAN interface:
   no shutdown
5) Exit configuration mode:
   end

setup.name: Enable Spanning Tree Protocol (STP)
setup.description: Prevent Layer 2 loops by configuring Spanning Tree Protocol.
setup.command:
1) Enter configuration mode:
   configure terminal
2) Enable STP globally (if not already enabled):
   spanning-tree mode [pvst | rapid-pvst | mst]
3) Exit configuration mode:
   end

setup.name: Port Security Configuration
setup.description: Limit the number of devices on a port and configure MAC address filtering.
setup.command:
1) Enter configuration mode:
   configure terminal
2) Select interface:
   interface [Interface]
3) Set port security:
   switchport port-security
4) Define maximum number of devices:
   switchport port-security maximum [Number]
5) Set violation action:
   switchport port-security violation [protect | restrict | shutdown]
6) Optionally, set static MAC address:
   switchport port-security mac-address [MAC_ADDRESS]
7) Exit configuration mode:
   end

setup.name: Assign VLAN to Interface
setup.description: Assign a VLAN to a specific port for network segmentation.
setup.command:
1) Enter configuration mode:
   configure terminal
2) Select the interface:
   interface [Interface]
3) Set the interface to access mode:
   switchport mode access
4) Assign VLAN:
   switchport access vlan [VLAN_ID]
5) Enable the interface:
   no shutdown
6) Exit configuration mode:
   end

setup.name: Configure EtherChannel
setup.description: Combine multiple physical links to increase bandwidth and redundancy.
setup.command:
1) Enter configuration mode:
   configure terminal
2) Select the interface range:
   interface range [Interface1, Interface2]
3) Enable EtherChannel:
   channel-group [Number] mode [active | passive | on]
4) Exit configuration mode:
   end

setup.name: Backup and Save Configuration
setup.description: Save the current configuration to startup-config for persistence.
setup.command:
1) Save running configuration:
   write memory
   OR
   copy running-config startup-config

basic.name: Enable SSH for Management
basic.description: Enable SSH for remote management and disable Telnet.

   transport input ssh
5) Set login method:
   login local
6) Exit configuration mode:
   end

basic.name: Configure CDP (Cisco Discovery Protocol)
basic.description: Enable CDP for discovering directly connected Cisco devices.
basic.command:
1) Enter configuration mode:
   configure terminal
2) Enable CDP:
   cdp run
3) Optionally enable per-interface:
   interface [Interface]
   cdp enable
4) Exit configuration mode:
   end

basic.name: Set Hostname
basic.description: Assign a hostname to the Panorama management system.
basic.command: set deviceconfig system hostname [DeviceName]

basic.name: Enable Secure Management Access
basic.description: Restrict Panorama access to authorized administrators.
basic.command: set deviceconfig system service disable-http yes

basic.name: Configure Admin Roles
basic.description: Define administrator roles with appropriate privileges.
basic.command: set mgt-config users [Username] role [RoleName]

advanced.name: Enable Logging and Monitoring
advanced.description: Ensure all firewall logs are centralized and monitored.
advanced.command: set deviceconfig system log-settings syslog-server [ServerName] address [IP] format BSD

advanced.name: Configure High Availability
advanced.description: Enable HA for failover and redundancy.
advanced.command: set deviceconfig high-availability enable yes

advanced.name: Apply Security Policies Centrally
advanced.description: Push predefined security policies to all managed firewalls.
advanced.command: set device-group [GroupName] pre-rulebase security rules [RuleName] action allow

advanced.name: Enable Certificate-Based Authentication
advanced.description: Require certificates for administrator authentication.
advanced.command: set deviceconfig system authentication-profile [ProfileName]

advanced.name: Configure Panorama Data Redundancy
advanced.description: Enable data replication for disaster recovery.
advanced.command: set deviceconfig system panorama-server [PrimaryIP] secondary [SecondaryIP]

advanced.name: Enable Auto Policy Updates
advanced.description: Automatically update security policies from Panorama.
advanced.command: set device-group [GroupName] policy-update enable

advanced.name: Enable Dynamic Address Groups
advanced.description: Use dynamic address groups for flexible security policies.
advanced.command: set dynamic-address-group [GroupName] filter [Criteria]

advanced.name: Enable Custom Threat Signatures
advanced.description: Create custom signatures for detecting threats.
advanced.command: set custom-threat-signature [SignatureName]

setup.name: Set Hostname
setup.description: Assign a hostname to the Fortinet device.
setup.command:
config system global
set hostname [DeviceName]
end

setup.name: Set System Domain Name
setup.description: Assign a domain name for system identification and certificate generation.
setup.command:
config system global
set domain [DomainName]
end

setup.name: Configure Management IP
setup.description: Assign IP address, subnet mask, and gateway for the management interface.
setup.command:
config system interface
edit [InterfaceName]
set ip [IP_Address] [Subnet_Mask]
set allowaccess ping https ssh http
next
end

setup.name: Set Interface Description
setup.description: Add a description to the interface to indicate its role.
setup.command:
config system interface
edit [InterfaceName]
set description [Description]
next
end

setup.name: Set Admin Password
setup.description: Secure the admin account with a strong password.
setup.command:
config system admin
edit admin
set password [Password]
next
end

setup.name: Configure DNS Servers
setup.description: Set primary and secondary DNS servers for name resolution.
setup.command:
config system dns
set primary [Primary_DNS]
set secondary [Secondary_DNS]
end

setup.name: Configure NTP Server
setup.description: Synchronize system time with an NTP server.
setup.command:
config system ntp
set status enable
set server [NTP_Server_IP]
end

setup.name: Set Default Route
setup.description: Set a default route for internet-bound traffic.
setup.command:
config router static
edit 0
set device [WAN_Interface]
set gateway [Default_Gateway_IP]
next
end

setup.name: Enable GUI Access
setup.description: Ensure GUI (HTTPS/HTTP) access is allowed for management.
setup.command:
config system interface
edit [InterfaceName]
set allowaccess https http
next
end

setup.name: Enable VDOMs (Optional)
setup.description: Enable Virtual Domains for multi-tenancy and administrative separation.
setup.command:
config system global
set vdom-admin enable
end

setup.name: Create Admin Profile
setup.description: Create a role-based profile to control admin access permissions.
setup.command:
config system accprofile
edit [ProfileName]
set secfabgrp read-write
set sysgrp read-write
next
end

setup.name: Save Configuration
setup.description: Save current configuration to persist across reboots.
setup.command: execute backup config flash

basic.name: Disable Unused Services
basic.description: Limit services to reduce attack vectors.
basic.command:
config system global
set admin-https-ssl-versions tlsv1-2 tlsv1-3
end

basic.name: Enable Logging and Monitoring
basic.description: Configure logging for security visibility.
basic.command:
config log setting
set status enable
end

advanced.name: Enable Intrusion Prevention
advanced.description: Enable IPS to detect and block threats.
advanced.command:
config ips sensor
edit [SensorName]
set action block
next
end

advanced.name: Enable Web Filtering
advanced.description: Control access to websites based on policies.
advanced.command:
config webfilter profile
edit [ProfileName]
set ftgd-wf enable
next
end

advanced.name: Enable Botnet Protection
advanced.description: Block connections to known malicious domains.
advanced.command:
config system global
set botnet enable
end

advanced.name: Advanced SD-WAN Security Policies
advanced.description: Enhance SD-WAN security with application-based routing and segmentation.
advanced.command:
config system sdwan
edit [PolicyName]
set internet-service enable
next
end

advanced.name: Microsegmentation (VLAN Isolation)
advanced.description: Restrict VLANs to limit traffic access.
advanced.command:
config system interface
edit [InterfaceName]
set intra-switch-policy deny
next
end

advanced.name: Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA)
advanced.description: Enable MFA for admin logins.
advanced.command:
config system admin
edit admin
set two-factor enable
next
end

advanced.name: Check Open Ports
advanced.description: Display listening services.
advanced.command: diagnose sys top | grep LISTEN

advanced.name: Failed Logins Monitoring
advanced.description: Monitor failed authentication attempts.
advanced.command: execute log display | grep failed

advanced.name: Detect Brute Force Attacks
advanced.description: Enable logging for intrusion detection.
advanced.command:
config log setting
set status enable
end

advanced.name: RBAC (Role-Based Access Control)
advanced.description: Assign admin roles and profiles.
advanced.command:
config system admin
edit [Admin]
set accprofile [Profile]
next
end

advanced.name: Stricter Logging
advanced.description: Enable logging and monitoring.
advanced.command:
config log setting
set status enable
end

setup.name: Enable FortiGuard Services
setup.description: Activate FortiGuard services for UTM database updates.
setup.command:
config system fortiguard
set fortiguard-anycast enable
set protocol udp
end

setup.name: Enable Automatic Signature Updates
setup.description: Automatically update antivirus, IPS, and web filter signatures.
setup.command:
config system autoupdate schedule
set status enable
set frequency daily
end

setup.name: Verify UTM Licenses
setup.description: Check that UTM features are licensed and enabled.
setup.command: get system status | grep Contract

setup.name: Enable Logging for UTM Features
setup.description: Ensure threat-related events are logged for visibility.
setup.command:
config log setting
set utm enable
end

setup.name: Create Security Policy with UTM Inspection
setup.description: Apply antivirus, web filtering, and application control to traffic.
setup.command:
config firewall policy
edit [Policy_ID]
set utm-status enable
set av-profile [ProfileName]
set webfilter-profile [ProfileName]
set application-list [ProfileName]
next
end

basic.name: Enable Antivirus Scanning
basic.description: Scan and block malware in network traffic.
basic.command:
config antivirus profile
edit [ProfileName]
set scan-mode quick
next
end

basic.name: Enable Email Security
basic.description: Prevent phishing and spam emails.
basic.command:
config emailfilter profile
edit [ProfileName]
set spam-filter enable
next
end

basic.name: Enable Application Control
basic.description: Regulate application usage for security.
basic.command:
config application list
edit [ProfileName]
set app-control enable
next
end

advanced.name: Enable Web Filtering
advanced.description: Control access to websites based on policies.
advanced.command:
config webfilter profile
edit [ProfileName]
set ftgd-wf enable
next
end

advanced.name: Enable Data Leak Prevention (DLP)
advanced.description: Prevent sensitive information from leaving the network.
advanced.command:
config dlp sensor
edit [SensorName]
config filter
edit 1
set name [FilterName]
set protocol http smtp pop3 imap ftp
next
end
next
end

advanced.name: Enable DNS Filtering
advanced.description: Block DNS queries to malicious or unwanted domains.
advanced.command:
config dnsfilter profile
edit [ProfileName]
set domain-filter enable
next
end

advanced.name: Enable Mobile Malware Protection
advanced.description: Detect malicious behavior in mobile traffic patterns.
advanced.command:
config antivirus profile
edit [ProfileName]
set mobile-malware-db enable
next
end

advanced.name: Enable Email Content Filtering
advanced.description: Inspect email messages for forbidden content or file types.
advanced.command:
config emailfilter profile
edit [ProfileName]
config file-filter
edit 1
set pattern .exe
next
end
next
end

advanced.name: Enable Safe Search
advanced.description: Force Safe Search on search engines to restrict explicit results.
advanced.command:
config webfilter profile
edit [ProfileName]
set safe-search enable
next
end

advanced.name: Enable SSL Inspection
advanced.description: Inspect encrypted traffic for threats using deep SSL inspection.
advanced.command:
config firewall ssl-ssh-profile
edit [ProfileName]
set inspect-all enable
next
end

setup.name: Set Hostname
setup.description: Assign a hostname to the F5 ADC device.
setup.command: tmsh modify sys global-settings hostname [DeviceName]

setup.name: Configure Management IP
setup.description: Set the IP address, netmask, and gateway for the management interface.
setup.command: tmsh modify sys management-ip [IP_Address]/[Subnet_Mask] default-gateway [Gateway_IP]

setup.name: Configure DNS Servers
setup.description: Set DNS servers for hostname resolution.
setup.command: tmsh modify sys dns name-servers add { [Primary_DNS] [Secondary_DNS] }

setup.name: Configure NTP Servers
setup.description: Set NTP servers for time synchronization.
setup.command: tmsh modify sys ntp servers add { [NTP_Server_IP] }

setup.name: Configure Time Zone
setup.description: Set the time zone for system logs and time-sensitive processes.
setup.command: tmsh modify sys ntp timezone [TimeZone]

setup.name: Set Admin Password
setup.description: Set a secure password for the admin account.
setup.command: tmsh modify auth user admin password [Password]

setup.name: Enable SSH Access
setup.description: Enable SSH service for CLI-based remote management.
setup.command: tmsh modify sys sshd allow replace-all-with { [Trusted_IP/Mask] }

setup.name: Enable HTTPS Access
setup.description: Enable web-based GUI management and restrict to specific IPs.
setup.command: tmsh modify sys httpd allow replace-all-with { [Trusted_IP] }

setup.name: License the System
setup.description: Apply the license key and activate the system.
setup.command: tmsh install sys license registration-key [License_Key]

setup.name: Provision Modules
setup.description: Allocate system resources to modules like LTM or ASM.
setup.command: tmsh modify sys provision ltm level nominal

setup.name: Save Configuration
setup.description: Save the configuration to ensure it persists after reboot.
setup.command: tmsh save sys config

basic.name: Enable Secure Management
basic.description: Restrict management access to specific IPs.
basic.command: tmsh modify sys httpd allow replace-all-with { [AllowedIP] }

basic.name: Enable SSH Key Authentication
basic.description: Secure SSH access with key-based authentication.
basic.command: tmsh modify sys sshd allow replace-all-with { [AllowedIP/Netmask] }

basic.name: Enable Logging and Monitoring
basic.description: Ensure logs are centralized and monitored.
basic.command: tmsh modify sys log-config destination remote-syslog name [LogServer]

advanced.name: Enable SYN Cookie Protection
advanced.description: Mitigate SYN flood attacks.
advanced.command: tmsh modify /ltm global-settings dos-attack vector add { syn-flood { enabled yes } }

advanced.name: Enable Web Application Firewall
advanced.description: Protect web applications from attacks.
advanced.command: tmsh create security policy [PolicyName]

advanced.name: Enable DDoS Mitigation
advanced.description: Detect and mitigate volumetric attacks.
advanced.command: tmsh create security dos-profile [ProfileName]

advanced.name: Enhanced Bot Protection with Behavioral Analysis
advanced.description: Mitigate bot attacks using behavioral analytics.
advanced.command: tmsh create security bot-defense profile [ProfileName]

advanced.name: Enable Advanced Load Balancing
advanced.description: Optimize traffic distribution.
advanced.command: tmsh modify ltm pool [PoolName] load-balancing-mode least-connections

setup.name: Create a Virtual Server
setup.description: Define a virtual server to handle client traffic.
setup.command: tmsh create ltm virtual [VS_Name] destination [IP]:[Port] ip-protocol tcp

setup.name: Create a Pool
setup.description: Group backend servers (nodes) for load balancing.
setup.command: tmsh create ltm pool [Pool_Name] members add { [Server1_IP]:[Port] [Server2_IP]:[Port] }

setup.name: Create a Node
setup.description: Define individual backend servers (nodes).
setup.command: tmsh create ltm node [Node_Name] address [Node_IP]

setup.name: Assign Pool to Virtual Server
setup.description: Link the virtual server to a pool for traffic distribution.
setup.command: tmsh modify ltm virtual [VS_Name] pool [Pool_Name]

setup.name: Create Health Monitor
setup.description: Check availability of backend servers.
setup.command: tmsh create ltm monitor http [MonitorName] interval 5 timeout 16 send 'GET /\r\n' recv '200 OK'

setup.name: Assign Monitor to Pool
setup.description: Attach the health monitor to the pool.
setup.command: tmsh modify ltm pool [Pool_Name] monitor [MonitorName]

setup.name: Create HTTP Profile
setup.description: Customize how HTTP traffic is handled.
setup.command: tmsh create ltm profile http [ProfileName]

setup.name: Assign HTTP Profile to Virtual Server
setup.description: Apply the HTTP profile to a virtual server.
setup.command: tmsh modify ltm virtual [VS_Name] profiles add { [ProfileName] }

setup.name: Configure SNAT Auto-Map
setup.description: Enable source NAT for proper routing to servers.
setup.command: tmsh modify ltm virtual [VS_Name] source-address-translation { type automap }

setup.name: Save Configuration
setup.description: Save current configuration to disk.
setup.command: tmsh save sys config

basic.name: Enable HTTPS for Management
basic.description: Secure GUI access with HTTPS.
basic.command: tmsh modify sys httpd ssl-certificate [CertName]

basic.name: Configure Admin Password
basic.description: Set a strong password for admin login.
basic.command: tmsh modify auth user admin password [Password]

basic.name: Restrict Management IPs
basic.description: Limit access to the management interface by IP.
basic.command: tmsh modify sys sshd allow replace-all-with { [Trusted_IPs] }

basic.name: Enable Logging
basic.description: Enable event and access logging.
basic.command: tmsh modify sys syslog include { [LogSettings] }

basic.name: Create Default Firewall Rules
basic.description: Block all and allow specific traffic as needed.
basic.command: tmsh create security firewall rule-list [RuleList] rules add { [RuleName] { action accept source { [SourceIP] } destination { [DestIP] } } }

advanced.name: Enable SSL Offloading
advanced.description: Offload SSL processing to reduce server load.
advanced.command: tmsh create ltm profile client-ssl [ProfileName]

advanced.name: Implement iRules for Traffic Filtering
advanced.description: Apply custom rules for traffic manipulation.
advanced.command: tmsh create ltm rule [RuleName]

advanced.name: Enable Application Security Manager (ASM)
advanced.description: Implement security policies for applications.
advanced.command: tmsh create security policy asm-policy [PolicyName]

advanced.name: Configure Network Firewall Policies
advanced.description: Create rules to filter network traffic.
advanced.command: tmsh create security firewall rule [RuleName]

advanced.name: Enable Secure Cookie Handling
advanced.description: Ensure secure cookie attributes to prevent session hijacking.
advanced.command: tmsh modify ltm profile http [ProfileName] insert-xforwarded-for enabled secure-cookie enabled

advanced.name: Enable HTTP Strict Transport Security (HSTS)
advanced.description: Force secure HTTPS connections.
advanced.command: tmsh modify ltm profile http [ProfileName] hsts enabled max-age 31536000

advanced.name: Enable Geolocation Blocking
advanced.description: Block or allow traffic based on geographic regions.
advanced.command: tmsh modify security bot-defense profile [ProfileName] geo-blocking enabled

advanced.name: Enable API Security
advanced.description: Protect APIs from common attacks using security policies.
advanced.command: tmsh create security policy api-protection [PolicyName]
